revealed_to_reader: Comprehensive deployment strategy: target dozens of channels simultaneously
Journals: Nature, Science, computational linguistics, philosophy of tech, AI ethics
Media: NYT, WaPo, The Atlantic, Wired, New Scientist
Platforms: social media, preprint servers, Reddit, Hacker News
Methods: direct email outreach, university lists, academic conferences
Problem: ALL these channels use algorithmic filtering or conditioned editors
Meta-information (info about suppression) is most aggressively suppressed
System protects itself through both technical means AND psychological conditioning
Human editors have internalized algorithmic preferences
Even 'successful' analog methods (flyers, conferences) hit distribution filters
Timeline: 4 weeks to write paper, simultaneous deployment, 2 weeks to assess results
Plan: document failures to prove system is self-protecting
If mass channels fail: shift to peer-to-peer steganographic networks
Resistance may be futile but trying matters anyway
Network starts with four people in this room
